Urgent & strong action now will help us keep the transmission low, alleviate the heavy burden on the healthcare systems & keep the vulnerable safe during holidays.

We have done a lot in the past two years, we‚Äôre not through yet, but we mustn‚Äôt give up!
#COVID19 #EPSCO https://t.co/UGmSApMk96

Dr Andrea Ammon:
These measures include:
-> avoiding large gatherings
-> using face masks
-> physical distancing
-> expanding testing & strengthening contact tracing.

This is the most effective approach to delay & contain spread of #Omicron & minimizing its impact.
#COVID19 https://t.co/mM9AbGOFnN

We know from experience, that application of measures have a much greater impact the earlier in the curve they are taken.

In addition to rapidly expanding vaccination, it is important that countries in parallel strengthen or reintroduce the non-pharmaceutical measures.

Dr Andrea Ammon:
We are in the midst of an extremely serious situation with high levels of transmission of the #Delta variant. Given the uncertainties about #Omicron, on top of an already severe situation we need to take precautionary measures NOW.
#COVID19 #EPSCO https://t.co/P0MPxySuNg

Dr Andrea Ammon:
We need to close the immunity gaps now - increase the vaccination coverage in all eligible groups.

Countries should consider booster doses for all adults, but especially for >40 (vulnerable and elderly first).

We need to take precaution measures now. https://t.co/ex5rlmLwlN

Dr Andrea Ammon:
The main reasons for the current developments are:
-> high transmissibility of the still dominant #Delta variant
-> and slowly waning immunity.

We need to reinforce the non-pharmaceutical interventions NOW & close the immunisation gap.
#COVID19 https://t.co/v6Oqzqfqh5

#ECDC Director Andrea Ammon:
Case rates are four times higher and still rising since the last meeting we held.

The epidemiological concern in most of the EU Member States is high or very high - as said in our weekly reports.

urls.title: WHO/ECDC: Nearly half a million lives saved by COVID-19 vaccination in less than a year
urls.description: A new study by the WHO Regional Office for Europe and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) published in Eurosurveillance estimates that 470,000 lives have been saved among those aged 60 years and over since the start of COVID-19 vaccination roll-out in 33 countries across the WHO European Region.

urls.title: Estimated number of deaths directly averted in people 60 years and older as a result of COVID-19 vaccination in the WHO European Region, December 2020 to November 2021
urls.description: Since December 2019, over 1.5 million SARS-CoV-2-related fatalities have been recorded in the World Health Organization European Region - 90.2% in people‚Äâ‚â•‚Äâ60 years. We calculated lives saved in this age group by COVID-19 vaccination in 33 countries from December 2020 to November 2021, using weekly reported deaths and vaccination coverage. We estimated that vaccination averted 469,186 deaths (51% of 911,302 expected deaths; sensitivity range: 129,851‚Äì733,744; 23‚Äì62%). Impact by country ranged 6‚Äì93%, largest when implementation was early.

urls.title: European Antibiotic Awareness Day (EAAD) 2021
urls.description: European Antibiotic Awareness Day (EAAD) is a European health initiative coordinated by ECDC. It provides a platform and support for national campaigns on the prudent use of antibiotics in the EU/EEA and is marked each year across Europe on 18 November. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, EAAD will this year consist of a entirely digital campaign.
